extendedInfo.description: Quickly is a simple app that creates an ongoing notification in your notification drawer filled with up to 12 shortcuts to an application launcher, direct dial to a contact, direct messaging to a contact, direct call to a contact, a shortcut to a URL, or applications that you can configure.Once the notification is created, expand the notification to see the shortcuts.The nice thing about Quickly is that it never runs in the background, and the only system resource it uses is about 800kb for it's notification. It's lightweight and efficient and will remain that way.NOTE:-----------------------------If you're using a Android 4.1 you will have to use a pinch-to-expand gesture to show the shortcuts when the notification is collapsed. "This addon uses pinch motions, not swipe motions. pinch from center to edge of notification area to get the shortcuts to display, and from edge to center to collapse it."Thank you Tim Strobel!------------------------------One of Android Police's 55 best new apps for February.One of Android Authority's 7 new sizzling apps of the week for February 22.One of Android Headlines Top 10 best android apps for March 2013.One of Appstorm's 30 modern android launchers------------------------------http://www.androidauthority.com/7-sizzling-new-apps-week-february-22-160056/http://www.androidpolice.com/2013/02/18/new-app-quickly-uses-jelly-beans-expandable-notifications-to-put-an-app-launcher-in-your-shade/http://androidheadlines.com/2013/03/featured-top-10-best-android-apps-march-2013.htmlhttp://android.appstorm.net/roundups/customization-roundups/30-modern-android-launchers-homescreen-replacements/------------------------------Stay tuned for updates.Current bugs:------------------------------No translations----------------------------Please contact developer for bugs and suggestions!Thanks!

reviews.title: Great concept, one gesture too many
reviews.comment: I love the idea but don\'t want to pinch to expand. Would be far more useful if the icons/launchers were just *there* without the expansion step.
reviews.author: Ed Marsh

reviews.title: Very handy
reviews.comment: Great idea to have app shortcuts in the notification bar.  Would love to be able to choose how many icons in each row (would prefer more ) Good app Dev! Recommending it to everyone :-)
reviews.author: Kevin Coll

reviews.title: Crashes upon start up, nexus 7 v2
reviews.comment: Sent bug report
reviews.author: Ryan Nutley

reviews.title: Won\'t launch about 75% of the time
reviews.comment: The app starts to open up on my Galaxy Note 2,  then the screen just goes blank. A waste of money.
reviews.author: FRANK IRELAND

reviews.title: Righteous!
reviews.comment: Brilliant app. And you, developer dude, are great because you respond so soon to reviews!
reviews.author: Anirudh Ramachandran

reviews.title: Good but...
reviews.comment: There is missing some columns edit, at least 6 columns would be nice
reviews.author: Braulio Navarro

reviews.title: Please update
reviews.comment: Updated to Android 4.3 and now this app keeps crashing
reviews.author: Sharon Angell

reviews.title: great idea
reviews.comment: Great concept... a couple of comments: 1- pinch to expand is cumbersome.  Icons could just be there (as others have suggested) 2- icons could be smaller and allow for more in a single line (see power toggles)
reviews.author: Alejandro Ogata

reviews.title: Very Nifty
reviews.comment: UPDATE 1: A a good idea,  is to make it while in app, if you long press on a slot like Facebook then drag onto another used slot to easily swap slot positions.   And also include a reset slots button for all or a specific slot  I would like what you said as your response to one of the comments, to have the first four apps shown without pinch to expand, that would be great, highly recommend, works on android 4.2.1 Jelly Bean! Also, i do like high priority mode :P, but because I am using a tablet, it makes it more awkward, so  please put first 4 apps show maybe
reviews.author: Aaron Brown

reviews.comment: Nice
reviews.author: Hussein Sibaii

reviews.title: Awesome. Worth the dollar!
reviews.comment: The best part is having a shortcut in my notification drawer to open a list of all my apps. New app drawer is awesome! :D Feature requests: Icon size and maybe be able to have less than four icons on a row. PS: thanks for making this such a great, clean, simple app! Android has needed it for a long time
reviews.author: Tony Russell

reviews.title: Galaxy S4 on 4.2
reviews.comment: Doesn\'t seem to be working. Crashes everytime I try and open it and I can\'t get my money back.
reviews.author: Michael Harrell

reviews.title: Great,  but..
reviews.comment: Could really do with being able to place where the notification shows in the list, like notishare does,  so I don\'t have to scroll down a congested list to get to Quickly.  [edit] Thanks for the reply- yes, that does the trick.Maybe the UI could be clearer that\'s what the priority setting does? Cheers.
reviews.author: Jon Hewitt

reviews.title: Awesome
reviews.comment: Great app. I\'ve used other shortcut apps, but this is definitely the cleanest looking. Highly recommend.
reviews.author: William Shropshire

reviews.title: Great idea, easy to use, but some bugs
reviews.comment: This gives really handy access to my favorite apps, easy to set up and quick and simple to use.  But it sometimes disappears from my notifications, and sometimes crashes.  Developer was responsive and quick to refund me even though I was past the refund period, so it\'s worth trying since it seems to work better for others.  I\'ll give this another try in a month or two to see if it\'s more stable.
reviews.author: Alexander Benenson

reviews.title: Update
reviews.comment: LE: thanks for the quick reply. Indeed it worked like you said!
reviews.author: Alin Rad

reviews.title: Great idea but lacks one simple setting
reviews.comment: Love the idea and initially I thought it had it all. But the icons take too much space, I sold love the ability to reduce the height of the notification, maybe increase the number of icons that may fit in one row..
reviews.author: Martin Hellgren

reviews.title: Keeps getting better
reviews.comment: Funny, i had 3 things i disliked and within a week you listened to me and fixed them all. Your doing a fantastic job.  Update: congrats on v1.0!
reviews.author: Adam Majer

reviews.title: Me likey
reviews.comment: Use it everyday.
reviews.author: Todd Moser
